40816774.review:
Completion State:
Completed all boss jumps and played a lot of free run (10.4 hours, 74% Steam achievements)

Comments:
Descenders is basically an arcade downhill mountain biking game where the tracks are procedurally generated. There are four terrain types each with it's own style, unique ramps and final "boss jump". These boss jumps are larger than life jumps each with it's own flavour that must be beaten three times to unlock a short cut to begin your run in each of the terrain types.

The game can be pretty challenging and the points loss for crashing is pretty severe in the career mode but that really doesn't matter as you hurl your way down a course, pulling off stunts with deft use of left and right stick while nodding your head to the great (assuming you like fairly floaty DnB) soundtrack. The sense of speed, the risk, the easy-to-understand-hard-to-master controls, all combine to make for a great time.

The game is technically in early access but there are no glaring technical bugs or performance issues (Ryzen 5 1600 / 1060 6gb). Content could be argued to be slim but the procedural generation of the tracks makes for a reasonable amount of replayability. The devs also seem committed to adding additional content and have already added a free run mode where you can tailor the course generation parameters or even just use a typed seed. They have also teased a park type level with half pipes and the like. If and when they do I will definitely pick it up again and play some more. 

All in all, a really good game that with some additional content capitalising on the great stunt controls could be on the cusp of being truly great.

40699044.review:
感谢奶牛关野蔷薇 [https://cowlevel.net] 和开发者 RageSquid 提供的体验与评测机会。本文同步发布于 https://cowlevel.net/game/Descenders/review/3060654

Downhill 和 Freeride 这类技巧性和危险性都很高的山地车运动，对于大部分自行车玩家来说，可能一辈子也不会尝试，只能平时通过红牛的节目和一些纪录片进行了解并保持关注。能够通过这样一款游戏来完成现实中无法去做的事情，颇有一种三星今年的广告 “Do What You Can't” 的意思。

玩游戏的时候很容易想到由育碧制作发行的《极限巅峰（Steep）》，虽然从内容上来说，《极限巅峰》表现的是雪山运动而《速降王者》表现的是山地车运动，不过从方方面面，这两部作品都有很多值得比较的地方。

【游戏内容】
游戏的内容是玩家操控自行车手完成赛道，并加入四支冠名队伍之一进行挑战。一开始介绍基本操作的任务完成后，就可以选择开始挑战了。游戏分为四个场景，每个场景中需要完成五条赛道，由于赛道是随机生成的，所以不用担心短时间内会感到无聊。

《速降王者》设定的过关难度不高，只需要骑车通过重点线就算完成赛道，而玩家对完成赛道的方式选择很多，可以选择求稳慢慢过，可以选择追求高速的快感，也可以选择尽可能多地完成特技动作。选择赛道之前能够看到该条赛道的坡度（Steepness）、弯道（Curve）和特技（Stunt），相比《极限巅峰》中的高难度与相对单一的过法来说，显然《速降王者》对于不想频繁更换键盘的休闲玩家更为友好。

游戏内能够自定义的装备，我早就料到不会打上各大厂商的商标。能够自定义的装备有自行车涂装、头盔、风镜、服饰等，之后也还会有更多能够自定义的项目。游戏的侧重点是操作技巧而不是装备性能，所以也没有提供更进一步的自定义细节，我觉得是完全可以理解的。

【操作】
游戏更推荐使用手柄控制，所以操作方面的感受基于 Xbox 精英手柄给出。

游戏的基本操作很简单，扳机键控制速度，摇杆控制动作。看上去控制还蛮简单，但是在游戏的过程中总感觉控制太过敏感，如果要精确地控制路线，还是需要经过不少练习。

在玩家达到一定等级后，会解锁进阶动作的指南（这不代表解锁前就不能做进阶动作），如果不满足于几个基本动作的组合，进阶动作显然是观赏性和难度都更高的选择。为了拿到高的分数，需要玩家对路线和速度的掌控都达到一定水平，此外还要掌握各种特技动作的操作和技巧，此外游戏的死亡判定也比较敏感，碰撞、倾斜、跌落等情况都有可能导致摔车。从这一层面来说，《速降王者》与《极限巅峰》相比，并没有简单到哪儿去。

【得分系统】
游戏的机制是，可以通过特技动作或高速骑行获得积分，每次挑战有尝试机会次数限制，摔车就会扣除分数并消耗次数，每完成一个额外任务会增加一次机会。次数消耗完则扣除大量分数并宣告挑战失败。玩家在挑战中途可以手动退出，也会扣除一些分数。

有意思的是，挑战失败后失去的分数是总分的 5%。这个机制在我看来让玩家能够更加慎重地选择游戏策略：分数低的时候不用太过担心，因为总分的 5% 很容易就能挣回来；分数高时风险与回报的越来越大的正相关性则会让玩家做出更多思考和选择。

这一机制的存在，我觉得是开发者想要引导玩家以更加积极的玩法去感受游戏的乐趣，避免玩家陷入肝一个月然后彻底弃坑的过程。最稳的过关方式并不能带来大量分数，想要获得高分的玩家们需要花更多心思去琢磨操作技巧和游戏策略。在这一点上，这样的得分系统确实能够为这一机制提供反馈。

【游戏画面】
相比玩法来说，游戏的画质并不是强项。不过仍然可以看得出开发者在使游戏对硬件配置更加友好的前提下在画面细节上下了很多功夫。各个场景都特点鲜明，并且场景中的细节（天上飞过的鸟群，山坡滚落的干草）处理都很用心。时不时能够碰到的特殊天气也很有意思，总能给人不一样的感觉。

不足之处，是游戏的场景设计比较保守，很多时候让人有逼仄的感觉，尤其是第一个场景“高原（Highlands）”，场景居然设计在一个被群山环绕的盆地里，令人费解。

另外，第一人称画面只能看到车手的双手而手臂是完全透明的，虽然游戏中侧重点并不在此处，不过时不时注意到还是会觉得非常出戏。

【音乐】
游戏的音乐部分完全可以单独出来讲，因为表现极限运动的作品中，好的音乐能够大大增加作品的表现力。与财大气粗的育碧相比，本作开发者在音乐的选择上还是显得比较保守，音乐的风格较为单一，几乎都是电子音乐。从烘托气氛的角度说，确实没有大的失误，不过作为对比，《极限巅峰》中的音乐数量更加丰富，风格更加多样化，甚至还有古典音乐的加入，常常给人耳目一新的感觉。

值得一提的是，开发者甚至细致地考虑到了玩家制作视频/直播的需求，专门说明游戏中的音乐不会给主播/up主带来版权上的风险，很有意思。

【其他】
虽然游戏仍处在“抢先体验”阶段，但游戏的优化非常不错，在我进行体验的这二十多小时中，并没有遇到特别影响游戏体验的 bug。

游戏提供简体中文，但机翻痕迹比较重，还有改进空间。

各个方面都可以看出开发者对于这款游戏的体验非常用心，游戏内可以直接反馈赛道的 bug，在社交平台、Discord 上也都能找到进行讨论的地方，Trello上甚至有开发者公开的游戏优化日志和计划。

【总结】
这是一款视角独特，取材新颖的游戏，以这种方式表现出山地车运动的紧张刺激，确实可以称为佳作。能够看出开发者对这款游戏非常用心，相信正式版发行后游戏体验一定会更好。

游戏面向的人群更亲相遇硬核自行车运动爱好者，对于纯粹找乐子的玩家来说，游戏的难度显得较高。游戏目前的定价（69 RMB）个人感觉略高，推荐打折时购买。

40472950.review:
Currently not really enjoying this game.. The double whammy you receive everytime you fall is too dumb to have been thought about for more then 10 seconds...
Normally when you bail (in any normal extreme sports game) you lose the combo or maybe a time penalty and you'll be restarted either at an earlier checkpoint at speed, or at current location in standstill. Not both at an earlier checkpoint and at a standstill. 

Whenever you fall 4 times within 6 levels you'll receive the following penalties:
1 - lose points of the jump that failed
2 - lose progress towards bonus objective (Eventhough a bonus objective might be perform 2 frontflips, which you might already have done, also before the checkpoint at which you're restarted)
3 - you get set back to a checkpoint further back
4 - you'll restart standing still, so have to start picking up speed al over again and probably won't make the first 1 or 2 jumps.
5 - you'll get demoted after a certain amount of fails... 

Really can't say i'm enjoying this. And fuck off with Practice mode, which has no effect to progress, but all levels are random so what practice? Every time you ride, it's the first time on that track, which means you might fuck up here and there. That's what extreme sports are based around. Fucking-up whilst trying to progress the sport, not falling 5 times in your season, you're out.

40459786.review:
Downhill Mountain Biking games are an under-populated genre to say the least.  There are some standouts like MTB Freeride and the irreverent Downhill Domination, but neither game has really been able to replicate those exhilarating POV GoPro videos on Youtube.  Luckily Descenders fills that void with a polished experience that keeps you coming back with its unpredictable courses and quick session-friendly gameplay.

While not pitched as a straight up simulation, Descenders feels like a pretty authentic experience with its physics-driven gameplay and sense of speed.  You can absolutely fly down hills, gradually feeling like you’re losing control, while you avoid obstacles.  Slamming into trees at high velocity leads to some straight up brutal impacts.  The progression of Descenders is organized kind of like Mortal Kombat arcade ladders.  The structure of the game really lends itself well to small sessions, but is definitely engrossing enough to keep you playing for hours.  There are 4 course themes with 5 standard runs for each, culminating in a “Boss Jump” at the end.  Standard runs in Descenders consist of racing to the finish line on terrain procedurally generated by the game.  You’ll sometimes have the choice of picking a run with a steep hill, lots of jumps, tight and numerous curves for turns, or a healthy mix of the three.  Boss Jumps are typically steep runs that end with a ramp to facilitate grandiose Evel Knievel-esque stunts.  While there is some agency in choosing the general structure of your run, you don’t have a choice in the terrain and obstacles inserted into the maps.  Obstacles can range from logs in the road, jumps over pits of rock, shore bridges that force you to keep your balance along with a large variety of others.  These obstacles prevent the runs from just feeling like you only have to control your speed and require some precision in how you approach each hill.  And you should definitely be careful on each of your runs.

Descenders has a health system.  For each session, you will start with 4 health and lose one health per time you bail.  Health can be regained by completing bonus objectives such as hitting a certain MPH mark or landing cleanly on a certain amount of jumps.  These are assigned at random before picking a course to tackle so be sure to choose wisely.  These objectives usually feel attainable; however there are times when it feels like your available course choices aren’t suitable to completing your assigned objective.  That usually leaves you to choose the safest course, so you don’t have to start from the beginning in case you bail.

This can be frustrating as the procedural nature of Descenders sometimes feels at odds with its structure.  Some courses can feel downright unfair with terrain proliferating tight spaces that don’t give you enough time to line up a proper way to conquer it.  These buggy courses happened only a few occasions for me and weren’t enough to hinder my experience.

Descenders can probably be best described as the Steep to Downhill Domination’s SSX.  The controls and your handle over your rider depend on how you distribute your weight and how fast you approach each obstacle.  You can’t land 50ft drops like in SSX, but if you approach a large ramp at a fast but manageable pace you can land most anything while throwing in a backflip or two.  There aren’t a large number of trick options and the main objective of each course really only boils down to “get to the bottom”.  Matt Hoffman this game is not. But it would have been nice to be able to do Bar Spins or Tail Whips and an available score-attack based trick mode similar to the Hoffman series.   However this might have also added some complexity to the controls and made it harder for extreme sports game rookies to learn the game.

Descenders is an easily recommended package to anyone feeling burnt by the lack of extreme sports games on today’s market.  With the absence of Skate, Tony Hawk, and SSX there is an absolute dearth of titles like these currently available.  Steep is fun but if you’re looking for something with a bit more manic-energy and variety of locales, Descenders might have what you want.  I’ve sunk a lot of time into this game and am absolutely stoked to see how Rage Squid iterates on this very solid foundation.

9/10

Don't buy this game.

Also let's not forget that if your character so much as stubs his toe on literally anything you will throw yourself off your bike in some true Saints Row 3 Insurance Fraud level shit


I have played more than 9 hours of this game and no matter how many different ways I try to do it I can't land the forest boss jump. Go as fast as humanly possible? You'll overshoot and die. Slow down a little? You'll hit the side of the building. Slow yourself down by holding up on the right trigger? You'll still hit the building. I've tried 70 km/s, 65 km/s 60 km/s 55 km/s. None of them work. Either you fall one inch too far and break every bone in your glass body or you land on the roof. And If you're lucky you'll land far enough back on the 10 foot roof to jump off and land on the ramp on the other side. That's honestly the best way I've found to beat the jump, and it's still inconsistent. 

A lot of the randomly generated maps are garbage. Not only can you not see whats on the other side of a ramp once you go over it, but a lot of the time it will just throw you off the course and into the woods unless you slow down to a crawl for every jump. 

Just all of the level design in the forest is awful. There are no chances to build speed. Every on a map with NO curves on the selection screen, you will still be bombarded by trees you can't see around a corner until you smash yourself on it. Unless you of course just slow down enough to where the game isn't even fun. 

It's not fast paced downhill mountain biking. Its downhill 10 mile per hour skipping all the jumps because its the best way to beat the game biking. 

No matter how many times I do the same jumps and the same corners, there is no consistency. You will still die more times trying to earn lives on the later levels its not even worth doing. Oh yeah a level with no ramps? Let me just do a quick 720 in the middle of this assfuck of trees infested forest.



HERES HOW YOU GET INFINITE SCORE

1. Complete every bonus on the first stage
2. Skip everything in the forest. Everything. Don't do jumps. Don't go fast. Don't even do the boss jumps.
3. Guess what? Skip everything in the canyon too. Luckily this stage doesn't have as much trash as the forest so you can try to complete some bonuses here. Although there are still jumps you literally cannot make with the level layout so be careful of that.
4. Peaks? Skip it. Just ride around every obstacle because right now that is how you beat the game. And you better pray to whatever god you worship you stacked enough lives to get through this garbage fire of a boss jump. I literally have played almost 10 hours and I not once have managed to find any consistent set up to beat this jump.
5. There you go. You won.

I'm really enjoying this game and find the levels and bike riding really fun. 
I think the "Rogue-lite" aspect of the game could use improvement. 

Some ideas I had were... 
- Introduce some stats like Speed, Control, Jump Height, Suspension, Landing etc. (On top of health). 
- Every level have maybe 3 challenges that each increase one of these stats slightly but not all of them each level. It's hard to complete all but possible. 
- Add a timer so you can't just keep going back up the hill and repeating jumps/challenges. 
- As you go through each run you get more powerful but the levels get harder. Your stats reset after each level though. 
- Bikes, Gear and maybe Characters dictate your starting stats (adds progression outside of each run). You could have a characater with low starting health but high stats,  or visa versa. 
- Bosses can be more than just jumps, maybe hard tricks or bigger versions of the stone henge and castle. 
- I would prefer having a REP (or different scoring system) for each run so you can compare runs. Would help with the daily run as well. 

I think this would make this a great Mountain Biking / Rogue Lite combination and an awesome game.

40356940.review:
Its a fun game with lots of potential that is let down some what by the reputation system and lack of an infinite practice mode. 
Doing tricks and getting air gain you rep, which is basically exp, which when passed a threshold, will rank you up into the next rank. the trouble with this system is that right now if you end up bailing 4-5 times and then get rekt, you lose a percentage sum of your total rep. at the lower ranks this is fine, as the loss can be made up in the next run, however passed a point, for me roughly the 75-90k, the loss is so much that if you bail 4-5 times, plus bail on your last chance, your looking at a 10-15k rep loss, which is a huge bump down. it is literally impossible to gain that rep back within one or two runs, and means that you end up running the first zone, highlands, over and over, grinding rep to try and have a net gain. This promotes a play style that is very conservative within the game, meaning that you are less likely to try and go for big tricks or to try and play the later stages as the net gain for rep isnt there. This is compounded by the fact that there is no true practice mode, and by that I mean there is apractice mode, but it adheres to the same 5 life system the the standard mode does, meaning that after bailing out, you have to load into a new level, and try and practice with the 5 lives you have, this is very limiting as it stops you from trying out massive tricks or trying to do funky things, as you as less inclined to do so, despite there being no rep loss within practice mode.

If the practice mode had infinite lives, allowing for more experimentation within the mode as well as having a wider more diverse hub area, as at the moment there are 4 paths, with 2 having ramps, but there is only 2 sets of ramps in each, limiting what can be done within the hub area.

Despite this, i would still recommend this game to anyone, as it can be fun to just jam, doing tricks and things, but the rep system forces you to play slow and the practice mode is a little underwhelming.

40339334.review:
Ce jeux est génial pour les simples raison qu'il me rappel plein de jeux que j'avais adorer : 
-Downhill domination (PS2) pour le theme. 
-MX vs ATV Reflex pour la physique, le 2 roues, la qualité graphique et la maniabilité.
-Skate pour le bunny hop qui est exactement comme le ollie (flick-it control)

Alors rapport qualité prix :
Le prix peut paraitre un peu cher mais une fois le jeux en main et la communauté vue vous comprendrais que ça vaut le cout.
Les dévellopeurs sont très présent sur le dévellopement du jeux.
Ils ont dit que plus le jeux sera plus populaire plus ils ajouteront de contenu

Les controles :
Jouez y avec une manette meme si le clavier est accepter.
Les controles sont faciles a prendre mais dur a master.
Le stick gauche est pour le controle du vélo et le stick droit est pour le controle du personnage.
Comme MXvsATV REFLEX.

La personalisation :
Vous pouvez changer le style de votre personnage avec les casques, les lunettes, le maillot, le pantalon et le vélo.
Les items se débloque quand vous terminez une session (que vous ayer gagner ou non).
Plus vous avez de réputation (XP) plus vous avez une chance de débloquer des items rare.
Les items n'améliore pas le personnage seulement votre skill.

Le gameplay :
Pour l'instant pas de free-roam/open world (prévu).
Vous commencez avec une course simple puis petit à petit vous avancer dans les niveaux et aprés 3 niveaux il y a un "Boss Jump" (un énorme saut) vous devez le passer pour acceder à la zone suivante.
Il y a 4 zones (pour le moment).

La reputation : 
La réputation est votre XP.
Vous en gagner en fesant des figures, en allant à une vitesse folle, en esquivant de peu des choses et etc...
Mais si vous tomber vous en perdez. (1% de votre réputation total)
Vous avez 4 vie au début si vous tomber 5 fois (car la vie 0 compte) vous avez perdu et vous perdez 5% de votre réputation.
Si vous abandonner votre session vous perdez 2% de votre réputation.

Les teams : 
Ils y a trois teams dans le jeux :
-Kinetic (vitesse-bleu)
-Enemy (cascades-rouge)
-Arboreal (freeride-vert)

Le choix de l'équipe ne change rien au gameplay.
Il changera la couleur de votre ATH.
Et vous donnera une tenu sponso par la team.
Mais vous ne pourrais pas avoir la tenue des autres teams.

Personnel : 
J'adore ce jeux en trois jour j'ai déja 32h de jeux.
La sensation de vitesse est génial.
On a 4 type de caméra dont une FPS donc génial !
J'attend avec impatience les prochaine MAJs

A really good looking & good sounding game, not just in-game audio but also the music which accompanies it.  

For an Early Access title it is very accomplished, but I am intrigued what more is to come.

Only a few negative points;
- I wish it was more sim and less arcade.  The ability to adjust direction whilst in the air is a big shame for me.
- Camera options are missing, no replay that I can see (yet) be nice to slo-mo some of those awesome moves!
- Customisation is pretty limited; I am sure more is to come.
- Would really like a free roam environment.  Maybe a large downhill forest to pick and weave your own route through.
- And of course no MP is a massive shame, this quality title is screaming out for it.

Despite the gripes above I do recommend this game without question, it's good enough already to be fun & challenging but I would expect a lot more to come if it is to justify the price.

40193811.review:
ひとまず、最初のセッションまで終えての感想。

これまでに発売されている「スノーボード系のゲームをMTBで表現するとこんな感じ」という質感。
基本的には各種動画にあるように、「スピードを出してジャンプ台でトリックをキメる」のが主な遊び方になると感じた。
実際のMTBライドのように「体の重心バランスにとにかく気をつける」という所についてシビアにゲーム内で再現しようとすると「ゲームとして成立しない」あるいは、「あまりにも難易度が高くなりすぎる」ので、あえてここは割り切ってゲームっぽい仕立てとなっているが、これは良い割り切りと言うべきだろう。
とは言え、ウイリーは勿論のこと、ポンピング（腕の伸ばし／縮み）で低い段差をいなすといったMTBならではのアクションが盛り込まれているのはとても喜ばしいかぎりである。

　コースが自動生成ということもあり、時に実際のトレイルなどで重要な要素である「コースのテンポ」というものがないというのはとても残念な点だ。
プレイしていて、どうしても目の前のトリックに集中すること「だけ」になってしまいがちで、「左、右、軽い下りでタメて・・・ジャンプ！」といった「コースの流れを感じ取れる面白さ」というものは事実上、存在しないといっていい。
これを成立させるには現実同様、どうしても手作りコースが必要となるのだが、これは今後のアップデートで期待したいところだ。
こうした重心やらコースの流れやら割り切りやらの都合で、「ゆっくりではあるけれど、自転車を操るオモシロサ」を感じることはできないし、またそれを実現させるのは果たしてコントローラー使用で可能なのか？とは思うが、ここはスピード＆トリックを楽しむソフトというのが本作との正しい接し方と理解するところであろう。

　BGMはソフトかつ、ミドルテンポな感じのテクノミュージックであり、「ドンツク、アゲアゲ！！」といった曲調ではないが、ゲームの中にあふれる自然な木々などと相まって、本作にとても良くマッチしているし、個人的にもとても好印象だ。
サントラDLCも発売されてイイと思う。


　2018年2月現在、アーリーアクセス作品ということもあり、どうしても作品のボリュームや細かい部分などで荒削り感やバグ？（ペダルを漕がないとスタートできないのに、”ペダルを漕ぐな”といったセッションがある、etc）も感じるが、コアとなる部分はよく組み上げられていると思う。
なにやら否定的な印象のレビューを書いていることは重々自覚はしてるが、しかし、プレイしていて何だかんだと時間を忘れて楽しんでいるというのが実際だ。
ゲームもMTBも好きな人、あるいはスノボ系ゲームが好きな人なら、セールを待たずして買ってもソンすると言うことは無いだろう。


今後の改善にとても期待が膨らむ作品だ。

40190492.review:
Hi my name is Dean, professional idiot! It is time for me to review this game now, sorry about that! 

 

Basics 

There are three teams in the game and its very important to choose carefully which team you play with, since there will be team specific nodes on the map which will determine what type of level you get. All levels are randomly generated and usually you get to choose one of three levels to go through, it’s a bit like Outrun in choosing your path, some will be locked off afterwards. At the end of each area there is a killer boss jump you must complete to go to the next area and the areas get harder the more you progress. Not only do they get harder but they are different from each other too, hopefully we will get more areas, track pieces and those daily challenges eventually. 

 

Teams 

Enemy (Red Bros) This is the stunt team and they get stunt track nodes, pretty fun. 

Arboreal (Green Bros) This team the track is a suggestion and their nodes are probably the weakest since its just open land and that land is quite baron. They need some natural stuff to trick off in these areas and is the weakest team. 

Kinetic (Blue Bros) the SAAAAAANIC TEAM, GOTTA GO FAAAAAST! 

 

Lives, Scoring and Tricks 

Score or REP is obtained by going fast, doing tricks and completing boss jumps which give huge bonus. Every time you bail you lose 5% of your REP, you can even start going backwards if you get a RKO out of nowhere from RANDY ROCKON! "BY GAWD MAGGLE". So choosing what stunts to preform where and when to play it safe is really, REALLY important in this game. Since your rank is tied to your REP and at higher ranks you really do not want to fall off your bike, think of it as ELO rather than a traditional levelling up system.  

 

Losing all lives –5% REP. 

Retiring –2% REP. This is sometimes useful if you get an awful track and you don’t want to lose more lives and rep doing this node. It is better to save lives and rep and ditch 2% than multiple 5%'s . 

Finishing an area and choosing not to continue to the next are 0% REP LOSS! This is really good if your running low on lives and just want to cash in what you have, its part of the risk / reward system. 

 

Tricks are good and responsive in this game, feel very fluid. The only thing I would suggest is allow us to go backwards at a complete stop, I really don’t want to hug a tree that badly! There are advance tricks lick holding the right stick up when falling from Hight to try not to die. There also is this really cool trick which isn't in the advanced section (naughty devs). It is like a pre-wind when in the air hold the left stick to the right and hold the right stick to the left. Then what you do is hold the right stick to the right and you will spin faster two the right, just mirror this if you want to spin left instead! 

 

Controls 

No key bindings just yet, very naughty! Devs promised they will be put in soon though, it is suggested to play with a twin stick controller though. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED! 

 

Loot System 

The loot in this game is random after you finish a game of it, the better you do in game the better chance of a rare piece of clothing or a bike dropping. I love this idea, it's like a loot box, but not of money and of gameplay very nice. Get over 50k in one run and you have the highest chance of an elite item, cool! :) 

 

Suggestions 

*Grinding or sliding on narrow poles would be fun, maybe some pegs? I know you wouldn’t be able to slide with them but could be an interesting bike mod that you could take or not? 

*Arboreal Nodes need to be better as a part of the green bros these tracks are not very fun and rather bland. Making your path is fine, but when it is just an open field with a few rocks and trees it's not that good. 

*Secret area for people that ironman the first four stages? Like a secret 5th stage would be mint, or just more area and track pieces in general. Just go nuts adding new things to trick off of and things to do make it truly special! 

*Map seeds would be good, let's say if you find a track you really love save the seed and share with friends! I know it's not a map editor but its more realistic option and if we could get it, it would be amazing. 

*Replays would be nice if you have a really sick run going, we could even make a YouTube video with replays, that would be nice. 

 

Final Thoughts 

This game is amazing, as long as the devs keep adding more to this game, this game may be near perfect! I love its pick up and play nature and that one more go vibe to it. The music is fantastic, wish we could get some Jungle music in there! 😉 It also runs really nice too, I wish the devs the best of luck, this is truly a fun game.

If you're looking for an addicting, satisfying, and actually challenging speed game, this is for you.

40171776.review:
Descenders is a wonderful extreme sports score-chasing game.

From the beginning of playing this game, I was struck by just how fun it feels to play. The sense of speed you get is great. The level of challenge in the game is varied. If you want to go down a track at full speed in the easiest environment, it feels very different than in the final environment. The sense of accomplishment that you get from pulling off a boss jump or finishing a level without braking is exhilarating. The controls are intuitive and the music is enticing. Once you start playing you do not want to stop.

This game is in a strong state for being early access. The game has only crashed once so far for me. The procedural generation on the levels works well the vast majority of the time. The levels that are generated feel unique and fresh. The content is sufficient: the environments all have their own feel and unique obstacles. The controls and gamplay are strong.

There are a some things that detract from the experience. A few times that I have seen, the ramps will spawn inside the track. This doesn't effect the gameplay that much because you can go off the track. The goals for getting extra lives don't always line up to the track's features. They are determined before you pick your track but even with a few to pick from, you might not always find a suitable track.

I can see many ways for this game to improve. There could be more obstacles and ramps added. The area off the track could be made to look and feel more exciting. More tricks could be added to the simple spins and flips that are available now. The developers have also said that they might work on mulitplayer and I would love to see that be finished. So far the team system feels pretty inconsequential and that could be expanded upon.

Overall, I recommend this game. I think that it is fully playable and enjoyable in its current state. If you like racing, extreme sports or other similar games, you will enjoy this.

40134047.review:
非常感谢奶牛关及开发者提供的评测机会~
奶牛关原文链接：[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/Descenders/review/3023371]https://cowlevel.net/game/Descenders/review/3023371[/url]

《速降王者》是一款仍在开发中的体育动作游戏，最大的特色就在于对山地自行车的高度拟真，通过一定的学习与训练，玩家可以做出前后空翻、空中回旋、急速转弯等时尚时尚最时尚的华丽动作。拥有过硬的物理系统与拟真效果，目前，游戏已经获得了91%的极高玩家评价，真的是款非常值得期待的体育动作游戏。

[h1]山地自行车[/h1]
谈到山地自行车，恐怕许多国人的第一印象都会有些问题，它并不是行走在小溪间、山林里，而是一个典型的“速降运动”，有兴趣的朋友可以看一些相关视频，比如：[url=https://www.bilibili.com/video/av6606571/?from=search&seid=8526129191817201404]【第一视角】红牛 山地车越野速降[/url]。从上而下，一路而行，选手战战兢兢、小心翼翼地控制好方向与速度，在每一个落差享受飞的瞬间。

速降不是竞速，决定性瞬间是不是足够帅气、炫酷，才是最主要的，高危险性也叫“安全第一”更为显著。

[quote=]这不是比赛！你可以按自己的风格和节奏玩游戏。  ——《速降王者》[/quote]

[h1]游戏难度[/h1]
如果说《速降王者》有问题，那一定出在难度上。[b]游戏控制过于灵敏[/b]，你往前骑就容易很快，向两边打方向就很难回到路中。相比之下，“兔跳”（自行车蹦起来）又因为地势高差，叫玩家难以判断到底能跳多高。

不仅如此，[b]死亡判定也非常敏感[/b]。游戏中，碰、擦石头、杆子、土堆、树干会导致死亡，过高的地方摔落就会导致死亡，车子往后退摔了导致死亡、车子倾斜倒了导致死亡。其中有些死亡判定真是太过公式化，缺乏真实感，叫控制的角色过于脆弱，视觉反馈上更是一点就倒的软绵绵。

雪上加霜的是，游戏玩法中的[b]惩罚机制也过于苛刻[/b]。一旦死亡，玩家就结束关卡进程、扣除少量积分并重新再来，而死多了达到上限就会结束场景进程并扣除大量积分。死亡意味着积分扣除，这种玩法是较温和的，死亡意味着进程刷新，对于学习梯度高的游戏来说，简直是不叫咸鱼玩家开心玩耍。

游戏控制的欠缺打磨和不尽合理的死亡机制导致速降王者对许多轻度玩家来讲基本是“[b]速降亡者[/b]”，游戏还未能将普通人代入速降的快乐中。

个人建议：[b]小白兔玩家请务必远离赛道，在开阔的原野上蹦蹦跳跳，感觉非常好，积分特别高~[/b]

[h1][url=https://trello.com/b/UIUrqPGq/descenders-roadmap]开发者的努力[/url][/h1]
从交互性来看，真实速降运动员对环境的感知、单车的掌控比屏幕玩家强太多，即使如此也要谨慎炫技，所以说没有足够的练习，想像宣传片那样拉风几乎不可能，[b]帅不过三秒是常态[/b]。显然，制作方在玩家上，选择了硬核的那群人，毕竟，“速降”这种小品类想要做好，靠的不是顾及大多数人。

开发者为了帮助玩家提高，注重社群的建立，在Discord、Reddit、Twitter、Facebook上都有交流。

除了开发计划的勤勤恳恳、社群建设的为民扶志，游戏本身[b]bug罕见、优化出色[/b]，都不会叫玩家失望。游戏中的7首[b]音乐也非常够味[/b]，关卡开场的[b]航拍摄影也是给力[/b]!

[h1]养成式玩法[/h1]
游戏玩法设计的最大框架，有些欧卡的感觉。玩家通过完成比赛、比赛中的精彩表现获得积分，通过[b]积分累计[/b]形成rank、等级段位，在此过程中还不断解锁运动物品，形成奖励。

随机生成地图，也增加了游戏可重复性，不错的自然风光与富有挑战性的难度，都有效延后了游戏的疲劳感。

当然，速降这种极限运动，视角镜头的切换也带来不小的快感，[b]如果能有自动抓怕、自动录像以及回放的体验，游戏将会更炫酷亮眼[/b]。

[h1]总结[/h1]
在我看来，《速降王者》的游戏难度还是过高，交互体验仍存在[b]玩家能力够不上最低门槛的尴尬[/b]，作为一名想要飞的玩家还是很希望开发者想些办法改善一下。对于喜爱速降游戏的玩家来说，如果你愿意投入足够的时间、精力，那这款游戏还是很难得的出色，[b]若仅仅是希望花钱买游戏、爽一爽的玩家，还请三思[/b]，建议等折扣购买。

Simple, clean, looks phenomenal. Worth the money even if you're only paying for the faith in it's delivery.


I really see this game taking off as a modern interpretation of the early 2000s, endless, procedurally generated flashgames with a lovely roguelike twist. Some constructive criticsm for the game's state atm: the "life" system is a pain in the ass to deal with every run--I get that they're going for a procedural, dungeon-crawl vibe but it fails to establish a risk-reward system that truly leaves the player wanting another try. Perhaps rewards for completing levels, something that alters how you play the game, would present more of an incentive; or simply get rid of being able to lose reputation.

And for the love of god, get rid of "lives" during practice mode. I shouldn't have to contemplate whether I should make a risky jump or not during a "PRACTICE" game session because it costs me the time to reload the entire session. 



Besides the qualms I have with its early access state, keep your eye on this one. A rejuvination of past nostalgia is always welcome nowadays.

40055592.review: Probably one of the best BMX games out there that I've seen. The gameplay runs great and I've had no frame dips at all yet. Using a controller is highly reccomended, keyboard is far too dificult. The game looks great and has many pros. Some of these pros include the whole level design being procedurely generated. It adds a whole new feel to it and allows you to play the same type of levels over and over and have different courses each time. The four current stages are plenty for an Early Access game. The four different "stages" are the hillside, forest, canyon, and mountains. The hillside is a more mellow, learning-the-game type of level. The forest is a larger step up in skill, including small groups of logs you have to jump over and many other things. The canyon has a lot more speed but is a lot more open compared to the rest. The last stage is by far the most difficult one. I don't have a lot of info on it because i messed up a lot but you can take my word, it's hard. You can experience various different rating on courses, like one that has a lot of stunts and is steep, or one that has a lot of curves and isnt too stunty. Every one of the three main features of the cours (steep, curves, and stunts) can all be at 0 or maxed out. The stage selection also works well in each level, you start doing one race and after that you can branch off to 3 more. After choosing one of those, you get 3 more courses. AFter completing one of the new 3, the total courses in that section goes back down to 3, giving you 1 race or possibly all 3 races. The final race in each level is a "boss" jump, special for each stage. The bit of course before the jump is random, but the jump is the same thing every time you play that certain boss jump. For example, if you jump over one thing and make it first try, then the next time you jump it, you get the same jump, but a different course before it. It keeps the jump the same but still adds that spice of difference between each run you do. Another good thing this game has is reputation, or a level system. The more tricks you do and the cooler they are, the more rep you get. But, if you mess up badly, you can lose a lot of rep from it and possibly derank. The final good thing I want to mention is the practice mode. This lets you practice on certain stages and not lose rep. The two things I think shouldn't be in this practice mode are the fact that you still have lives and can't skip directly to the boss or choose, for say, the final stage unless you beat the boss challenge 3 times. For the cons, a lot of people say the price is too high. Currently, yes I would say $22.50 is a lot for the type of game it is currently, but it is in Early Access. The game will develope and have more stages and a lot more in general, balincing what you get for your money. One annoying thing I did find was the challenges, which can become quite difficult, especially in the forest I found. In the forest, there are a lot more non-ramp stunts to perform, so having to do 2 360s becomes quite difficult. So take that as you wish, I do reccomend the game and especially use a controller when playing it.

40052442.review:
刚买了暂时还没时间玩太多，可能发现的问题还不太多。而且因为此类游戏很少，所以很多地方仅针对现在相对热门的Steep作一下对比，供大家参考。(这两个游戏没有可比性，只是为了没玩过还在观望的玩家类比一下某些相近的部分）

[h1] 画面：[/h1]这个价格，画面完全可以接受。但全特效高分辨率依然距离商店的截图还差一点…… 不知道是不是我个人的硬件问题
[h1] 动作：[/h1]流畅度满分，可操作性极强。难度和操作类似steep，需要操作的按键并不多，但十分需要手感，想玩得爽还需要很多练习，不管是完成一次完美的竞速赛还是漂亮帅气的空中花式动作都非常有成就感和观赏性。
[h1] 玩法：[/h1]目前的玩法很少，而且也不像steep那样是开放世界。但好在是随机生成的地图，而且没有严格的赛道限制，能找到一条不容易摔跤的近路直奔终点也算本事。总之非常适合反复游玩。唯一让人有些不满的是，在steep里面你可以听着歌，漫无目的地随心所欲摔摔摔。但在本作中，摔跤是会中断当前进度的（被强制拉回赛道重新出发，像其他传统体育竞速游戏一样）。希望以后能增加一个禅模式或者说是无尽模式，供大家自由放松，不用一直那么紧张。
[h1] 音乐：[/h1]对我个人来说，音乐比steep更胜一筹。我没记错的话，原本的英文介绍中是有对电音厂牌/DJ的简介的，似乎是专门对本游戏原创的。反观steep有些音乐让人听着很难受（比如winter fest的那几首曲子，让人越听越想摔），还不能切歌选歌，很多时候只能关掉游戏内音乐，用播放器在后台放自己的音乐。

目前本游戏还是初登EA，有此素质真的非常棒了。反正不喜欢可以退款，喜欢steep的朋友们不妨买来试玩一下。

Une longue attente mais ça valais le cout d'attendre!

nous avons souvent été très déçu par la maniabilité dans les jeux de cyclisme, même si ce n'est pas parfaits descenders nous offrent une maniabilité et une jouabilité asser bonne
ça tourne sec parfois mais il y a ou aura certainement l'option pour régler les paramètres du controler
le comportement du biker et de son bike est parfois très étrange, des chutes évité on ne sait par quel miracle et parfois l'inverse mais ça reste très rare et cela offre quand même un petit plus à la jouabilité (aux gouts de chacun, simu, arcade)
peut-être un peu plus arcade que certain l'espérait mais cela va parfaitement dans le style du jeu 

les graphismes sont peut-être le point le moins positif du jeu; et c'est quand même très bon
Ces graphismes sont très basic en particulier les décors extérieurs à la piste qui ne sont finalement que secondaire
une fusion entre graphisme et jouabilité très reussit, des climats très different sont proposés du grand soleil au brouillard épais, cela nous donne un aspect encore plus réaliste au jeu
il y a pour l'instant 4 types de décors différents, des plaines verdoyantes au desert d'Arizona en passant par des grands etandue forestiers; simple mais diversifié
quand même assez étonnant de voir les machins de paille ronds que font les fermiers se balader dans les plaines et très frustrant de s'en prendre un dans la tronche 

aux premiers level passer un choix d'équipe "sponsor" vous sera proposé et celui-ci influencera en partie votre évolution dans le jeu
j'ai choisi pour ma part l'équipe Arboreal, parfois pendant le choix des compétitions auquel vous participez une manche "partenaire" de votre équipe vous sera proposé; 
pour arboreal il ne sagit plus d'une course sur une piste toute tracée mais d'un parcours en open world d'un point A à un point B
aucune limite de temps aucune restriction juste de l'exploration de la découverte de l'open world comme je l'aime
je ne sais rien en ce qui concerne les autres équipes mais la surprise fait aussi partie du jeu

À part le mode "carrière il n'y a finalement pas beaucoup sur le jeu, seulement un mode training puis un mode daily event qui n'est pas encore dispo
un jeu en accès anticipé qui a l'évidence va le rester pendant un moment
ce jeu va je l'espère beaucoup évoluer, nous y vérons certainement beaucoup de contenu ajouté
l'activité très importante des devs les semaines précédant la sortie annonce du très bon et un suivi important pour l'évolution du jeu
accès anticipé ça peut faire peur, moi le premier, mais avec une équipe de devs qui a l'air aussi motiver je pense que l'on peut avoir confiance et en espérer beaucoup

je vais terminer par le très gros point négatif du jeu qui est le niveau de difficulté et là c'est extrêmement mauvais, faire de super jump en double backflip ne rapporte que très peu de points 500 à 700 et le multiplicateur ne fonctionne pas
une chute même complètement banale vous fait perdre énormément de points, dans les 1200 à 1400 et vous fait perdre 1 ou plusieurs points de vie le chalenge est donc de vouloir faire des figures et prendre des risques mais avec cette maniabilité qui est très douteuse a grande vitesse, cette gestion des contacts qui est lamentable, la vue qui est très mauvaise, le tout réuni fait que monter des Level devient une torture et gâche tout le plaisir
il n'y a de plus rien d'autre à faire sur le jeu que de monter sont Level et sa réputation, les 4 map se débloquent très rapidement ce qui fait qu'au bout de 4 ou 5 heures de jeu il n'y a vraiment plus rien d'intéressant et cela devient extrêmement répétitif et ennuyeux j'espère que d'ici quelques mois ces points auront été amélioré ou mon évaluation passera bien évidemment sur la négative

Refunded the game due to bad controls but I could not stop thinking about it so I've bought it again. 

Second time I've spent some time finding workarounds for its amateurish issues and made it enjoyable. After I've put down some effort I can say that I am satisfied with my purchase.

  PROS
- Honestly it is fun to play
- Good sense of speed
- Not too shabby implementation of procedural generation

CONS 
- IMO physics should be far less forgiving (devs please add some more weight to it). I hope game will not be dumbed down even further as it is often the case due to demand of vocal casuals. Fingers crossed..
- Controls are suuuuper sensitive. Workaround is to edit your gamepad sticks/triggers responsiveness (use extra wide in steam big picture gamepad configuration), otherwise game seems to reach 100% on 10% of the both sticks and triggers travel making it almost unplayable without this workaround.
- Graphics are meh and animations are stiff but they serve the purpose.
- Player sports the smugest face ever, just look at his chin while in the shed. Daaaamn boi get a hold of yourself.

Yet I only feel a slight agitation on the inconsistent level decisions. After the first stage "the highlands" the reliability for bonuses drops. For instant the Forest level would benefit from steep down hills and massive jumps or straight B line shots for speed. Yet every stage on the map is switch back gates and pits. But the bonus supports either speed or jump tricks. The variation that’s being touted is nonexistent versus the actual play. Sure, it’s nice having a fresh stage every time you play, but when its inconsistent with your own system it becomes frustrating. Eventually your just grinding stages at the slowest or safest maneuvers to saves lives for the boss jump for progression.  Wouldn’t it be better If the stages invited risk over reward?  Again, I want to like it, but it suffers from multiple fatal flaws.  No time trials or speed attack stages, and loot or skins are given only for progression. What about multi player stages? I would say that this one needs major dev insight into what they are trying to accomplish over this procedurally generated mess.

40014072.review: You decide the difficulty. Either bomb it, or ride the brakes. It's all up to you, but keep in mind that the game makes you push the limits if you want to advance to the next area. The health/reputation (experience) system is a great dynamic for this game, as with a more passive approach, you can save all your health for the final boss jumps at the cost of a slower rep gain. 39990743.review:
Descenders is one of those rare gems that comes by once a blue moon and leaves you wanting more. Descenders is a high speed all out downhill MTB game that reminds me of Downhill Domination way back on PS2 yet takes all aspects of that game and makes a great improvment on what was once thought as the best MTB game to date. 

Each area of the game is seperated by a different biome such as Highlands, Forest, Canyon, and Peak. You start with Highlands which does not have many obsticles and guides you on how the game will play. As you progress through the game you will unlock more areas and it will keep getting harder and harder as you progress. Each area also has a "Boss Jump" at the end which will test your skills and the only way to progress is to clear the jump, which is easier said than done.

If I had only one complaint it is that the trick system is a bit lacking, you have flips and spins yet there is not off bike tricks such as supermans, tail whips, bar spins, etc. Yet overall the game is well worth the money and with the randomly generated worlds you will never have the same path twice and even sometimes they will throw in a full curve ball and really shake things up with night maps, fog, rain, heavy snow, etc. 

I give the game a solid 9/10 and plan on putting many more hours into it. BUY IT!

39990628.review:
Right, let's get one thing straight: Descenders is a hard, punishing game, and I love it.

The meat of the content in Descenders (especially in Early Access) comes from your own personal improvement. If you want to get more hours out of it, then bolstering your skills and climbing the leaderboards will likely be a huge part of that. I always enjoy games whose longevity depend on their skill ceiling (see: Rocket League), and Descenders is an incredibly well designed example of those games.

The developers/publisher have a ton of heart and a close eye on the sensibilities of their community, and it really shows with Descenders. Let me put it this way: I'm forced to run this game at the lowest possible settings just to get a stable framerate, but I'm way too busy having fun to care. HAY BALE!

39990522.review:
This review is strictly to reflect the game's current state as far as value for money is concerned. It has a strong fun factor for sure. You control a little biker dude down short procedurally generated tracks, getting points for stuff like tricky maneuvers and near misses. That's it. There's also a game on Steam called Superflight, where you control a little wingsuit dude down procedurally generated maps, getting points for stuff like tricky maneuvers and near misses. That game costs 2 euros. This one costs 23. See the problem?

Basically either the price needs to go down or content needs to be added for it to be worth the money. It's worth following the development, because all that said, the game's heart is in the right place: core gameplay is fun, music is awesome, graphics are vibrant, so fingers crossed they end up adding enough meat for the game to be engaging for more than a couple hours.

39990186.review:
[h1]NICHT OHNE MEIN FAHRRAD![/h1]

Ruhige Wälder, friedliche Wiesen, die Schmetterlinge flattern fröhlich umher...
Lass da ma mit dem Fahrrad runterbrettern!

[h1]Die Technik[/h1]
Grafisch ist Descenders grundsolide.
Performance is gut.
Sound ist gut. Musik ist Geschmackssache. ^^

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Wähle eine neue Session und stürz dich in einem Affenzahn den schmalen Track hinunter. Baller dabei durch Wälder, über Rampen, mach Saltos und... stürze, stürze, stürze. Dank Checkpointsystem startest du aber direkt wieder einige Meter weiter oben und bist sofort zurück in der Action. Zumindest so lange, bis dir deine "Leben" ausgehen.
Aber selbst dann hast du dir immernoch ein wenig Reputation verdient, schaltest neue Gegenstände für deinen sicken Fahrer frei, levelst ein wenig auf, schließt dich einer von drei Fraktionen an und stürzt dich wenig später direkt wieder den Hang hinunter.

Die Strecken werden dabei prozedual generiert und bieten so immer wieder eine neue Herausforderung und man schaltet weitere Gebiete frei.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Descenders ist ein Game für zwischendurch und macht das, was es machen will wirklich gut. Gerade das Gefühl für Geschwindigkeit kommt gut rüber und wer irre ist, schaltet in die Ego-Sicht. :D

[h1]Von mir gibt es einen Early Access Daumen nach oben![/h1]

Wer einen ehrlichen Eindruck zu Gameplay, Atmosphäre und Sound gewinnen will, schaut einfach mal in mein Angezockt rein:

[b][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6JcigpF3gDU]Angezockt: Descenders[/url][/b]

Ich wünsche - wie immer - viel Spaß beim Zocken! :D

39988651.review:
I was late to the party with Descenders, got an email from the publisher a few days from release offering a copy of the game for content creators.  I was excited from the moment I watched the trailer.  The sense of speed and control you have over your bike going downhill is something I haven't personally seen in a game.  You can rest assured that the trailer represents exactly what you will be doing in this game. Going fast. 

If you are going to play this game, bring a controller- I couldn't imagine playing without one, seems weird to even try it without.  I used an Xbox One controller and there was even force feedback when you go over rough terrain, something common for those who play on consoles, but I play 99% PC games with keyboard & mouse.  

[b]Likes:[/b]


Control is very tight and easy to pick up and play, hard to master. This gives you a goal to get better each time you play.

The soundtrack is nice, albeit a bit repetitive if you get stuck in certain areas. Drum & Bass music is a-ok with me!

The way to play this game is first person perspective in my opinion- feels very satisfying (and terrifying at times) to pull off flips, spins, jumping big gaps in this mode. 

[b]Dislikes (things that need work imo)[/b]

The bonus system at times does not make sense to me. You have limited lives to complete a map (series of courses). You can gain a life by completing a task (do X amount of tricks, complete track in X secs).  Seems random, as the courses are also procedually generated but the bonus is almost never attainable for someone of a lower skill level.  Would you not need the lives more as a lower skilled player?  If you were good enough to get the bonus, you wouldn't need it.

The Forest levels were not enjoyable to me, but I've liked all the rest of the maps just fine. Lots of curves, many tracks had few ramps, and the end level (boss jump) had such an extreme challenge for me that I found myself playing the rest of the levels conservatively so I'd have all my lives for the boss jump.  

[b]Features that I'd like to see:[/b]

Some form of multiplayer

Ability to share the seed of the procedural track you generated to compete with friends on the track

Track creator tool

As I said before, if the trailer looks good to you, this comes recommended!

39987674.review: Overall pretty great game, having a blast crashing into trees *_*

39986595.review:
Pretty fun game all around. Its not simlike at all so dont expect a lot of realism. Its not overly arcadey either like you would have seen in games like SSX tricky. You do tricks but they are flips and spins.  There is an extreme feeling of speed on the downhill steep tracks , so much so that I cant get down them most of the time. So there is a learning curve with using the steering with skids at big speeds. Also plenty of courses with minor steepness so you arent always out of control. 
Its great to see a game come along with biking and be a lot of fun done correctly. Like I said its not a simulation but it is a lot of fun. Excited to see where they take things as development goes on.

Ill also say this isnt so much a traditional racing game, its more of a obstacle course/survive till the end game. With the procedural generated courses it is impossible to have timed leaderboards since no one is ever on the same course so there is nothing to compare times on/with. It still feels like racing in the heat of the moment. You have to remind yourself that speed isnt always the point when you are faced with just finishing being a challenge on some of the hard courses.

39985602.review:
After almost 200 hours I would like to write a statement here, what I love about the game.
The first thing to say to me is that I come from the bmx scene, and a big part of my life insisted on riding ramps and dirt trails.
So I had high expectations of the game and hoped that I would find a game here that would bring the feeling of life of riding trails a bit into the game,since I couldn't really drive because of injuries.
There was no real bike game since ages, and i hoped descenders would fill this gap here.
And it did.
I wasn't disappointed when I rush down such a hill in Canyon and try to master a fat trail line with flow, then the feeling comes across really good to jump into a line like in real life and make the best out of going to your limit every time.
 
You can't compare descenders with a bike simulator, but it gives the feeling of riding a bike perfectly without the annoying features of a simulator.
I often talk about emotion here, but that's exactly what makes Descenders so unique.
It's just super intuitive to play with the controller, you can really get used to your own style, just like in real life.
 
Descenders is solid throughout and it's easy to see that you understand your craft and enjoy it very much.

Keep up the good work, cant wait for the final release!

39984323.review:
If you like extreme sports games, and a challenge, you'll like Descenders. 

Pros:
+ Easy to pick up, difficult to master
+ VERY smooth gameplay. No stutter, no FPS drop. 
+ Satisfying gameplay, whether it's going fast and not crashing, or landing a trick you thought you wouldn't have. 
+ Procedurally generated trails so you'll never get bored of a track. 
+ Soundtrack is amazing, especially if you like DnB. And it's extremely satisfying when it drops when you hit a jump.
+ Adrenaline rushing, especially at low health. If you're on the final trail but with no health left, it gets your heart racing.
+ Only cosmetic items, it's not Pay to Win. 
+ Huge variety of items to customize your character with.
+ Great time killer. 
+ No huge and/or game-breaking bugs
+ Controller support (much better to play with a controller)

Cons:
- Though the trails are never the same, the environments themselves can become a bit repetitive.
- There are some small bugs (but that's expected with early access)
- Can't look around in game (turn your head). 

Overall, the game is great so far. And it has A LOT of potential to become something even greater. 

I recommend it for anyone who likes to go fast and do some satisfying tricks while wearing a pepperoni pizza shirt.

Usually i don't write game reviews, but for this game, i had to wirte one.
I grew up with "Downhill Dominaton" as one of my favorite games, and Descenders gave me a good throwback to that time. And thats the reason why i have to write this review.

The Gamepaly is amazing, controlls are onpoint, and the feeling of the speed is amazing (even better in first person).

One of the big features of this game are the procedurally generated tracks.
The generated tracks have placed objects and ramps on them at various locations. In my opinion, there are not to many 
different objects/ramps in the game. By adding more ramps/object, it could rise the variation of tracks and the variation on the tracks, and so make the game even better.

Descenders will also give you the freedom to play however you like to play the game.
You don't have to worry about a timelimit or go through any checkpoint, so could just ride straight to the finishline without takeing any risk or explore the map around the track.

The soundtrack is great, a bit Drum and Bass heavy.

The health-system can be challenging and gives the game it's difficulty.
You can take the save way and play every track in the area before you head to he boss jump or you just go straight to the boss jump with less health. It's really up to you, how challenging you want to be this game.

The only thing that i really miss is an map creator or any way to create custom content.
Custom content can booste the community of Desceners.

This game is worth the 20€, and i hope it will go only up from here.

Well thats my first "true" review of an game, it's kinda chaotic but who cares.

39970135.review:
[h1]Pros[/h1]
It's like Binding of Isaac, but you're riding bikes downhill instead
The feeling of speed is excellent
Drum and bass soundtrack is awesome (though there's some songs in the beta that didn't make it to release)
Procedural generation keeps things fresh
Controller controls work great
Devs always actively taking feedback into consideration and fixing bugs
Polished for an Early Access title

[i]this game is in Early Access, so most if not all of these cons will be addressed down the road[/i]
[h1]Cons[/h1]
Needs more biomes
[strike]Keyboard keybindings may be awkward; currently not remappable[/strike]
Your rig can't be too potato or you'd have to decrease resolution and graphics settings to run it at >60 fps

If there's one thing that can be learned from developer RageSquid's portfolio, it's that they really seem to love going fast. First [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/285820/Action_Henk/]Action Henk[/url], which put you into the shoes of a fairly fat toy character who has to run fast. And now this, which has you riding bikes downhill on levels of varying steepness, with varying amounts of stunts and curvature, and scenery. 

There are 3 teams you can pick at some point in the game, which influences the specific team nodes you'll get. Enemy is more stunt-oriented, Arboreal loves the off-road, and Kinetic is all about the speed. Despite your allegiance to a team, however, there's really all 3 of each team in us - just in differing quantities.

I honestly never thought I wanted a rogue-bike until this game was announced (and playing the beta got me even more hyped up for this). 

The price may seem steep considering what is currently in but I can assure you it's well worth it. The procedural generation makes things fresh, though they do need to add more possible proc-gen elements or it's going to turn out much like DiRT 4 was. Soundtrack just fits the mood oh-so-well; I loved Ratz Instagib's soundtrack and this, while not being by the same label (Liquicity as opposed to Jazzsticks) feels like a logical progression. Feedback is also merely a few keystrokes and mouse clicks away - join the verified [url=http://discord.gg/descenders]Discord server[/url] and chime in. The developers are very open to feedback - it's in Early Access after all and they sorely NEED it. Anything you feel needs improved? Tell them!

Full disclosure: Part of the reason I got this was because Bike Rose...sorry, Mike Rose...is unequivocally an awesome bloke. While I've heard of RageSquid from Action Henk (but still haven't played that title yet), Descenders was the first title from them that I've really sunk my time into. I've known him since his days at tinyBuild, but only really got to know him better during his short stint at Ripstone. He's genuinely a smart and funny guy; with a lot of experience gained from different publishers with different working styles, getting your game [url=http://nomorerobots.io/]published with him[/url] means that it's in relatively safe hands.

Now if you'll excuse me, I'm gonna sink more hours into this. It's all downhill from here.

[h1]When to buy[/h1]
I've been told this game won't go on discount or bundle for a while. If you want to come help shape the development and contribute feature suggestions, get it now and chime in. You're also welcome to wait until it's out of Early Access as the price won't be increased.

Either way, don't miss out.

[h1][b]EA+++/10[/b][/h1]

39968034.review:
První česká recenze, such wow.
V kostce - Je ta hra dobrá? Ano, ta hra je dobrá. Moc dobrá.
Je ta hra dobrá za 20€? Záleží na tom, kdo si jí kupuje.
Descenders je hra o DH závodění, nic víc od toho nečekejte, není pro každého. Není to AAA hra a ani nemá takové ambice. Je uživatelsky přívětivá a nabízí naprosto nevyčerpatelné možnosti které jen tak neomrzí. Obtížnost mi přišla místy mírně přepálená, zejména ve Forest biomu, nicméně je to způsobeno procedurálně modelovanými tratěmi, což není vůbec na škodu. Implementace takového prvku (nutně podotknout funkčního, ne jako v NMS.) dělá ze hry opravdu unikátní kousek s velkou uvěřitelností a pocitem svobody, který jsem naposledy zažil u STEEPu (a předtím nikdy). Celkově produkt hraje na nostalgickou strunu, takže spoustě hráčům (doufám že i českým) se hned při prvním whipu vybaví ten pocit volnosti, který měli u Downhill Dominatoru na PS2.
Chování jezdce je víc než uspokojivé a je na něm přesně vidět, že ještě není potřeba velkých financí na velkou hru. I přesto, že je vytvořena opravdu malinkým Indie studiem, bez motion capturingu a v Unity enginu - je vidět, že jí dělal tým nadšených lidí, kteří se vyznají v kolech, kteří koly žijí - o důvod víc, proč není 20€ moc za tuhle hru (koukám se na vás, kteří si kupují každý rok nové CoD a Assasíny za 60€)
Další věc, kterou bych vyzvedl je soundtrack. Sic ho není mnoho, ale je skvěle vybraný a krásně podtrhuje pocit nespoutanosti. Vy víte že jede jinudy, hra to ví, ale neukáže vám žádnou výstražnou značku, naopak pustí nějakou pecku, aby vám to lépe šlapalo ;-)
Jediná věc, která lze vytknout je day one optimalizace. S i7 6700 a GTX 1070 jsem dosahoval ne moc uspokojivých 30-60fps na Ultra detaily a "pouze" 50-70fps na Medium detaily, nicméně očekávám zásadní změnu v příštích dvou, třech patchích.
Sečteno a podtrženo - za první večer hraní jsem našel hlavně to dobré. Ano je to indie arcadovka, ano jsou tam bugy, ano je to ale pořád Early-Access. Ta hra je pro všechny, kteří někdy jeli aspoň z hospody na skládačce. Jestli chceš podporat takovýhle skvělý počiny tak je tohle totální must-have. A pokud pořád váhate, tak nezapomeňte, že existuje refund.

So far So good, Zatím to nejlepší z 2018 | 90%

39961994.review:
Note: the game was provided by Roel of RageSquid. Thanks for the opportunity.

This is a fun little indie extreme freeriding experience. The gameplay is easy to pick up but hard to master. There is definitely a difficulty curve as the game is punishing if you're careless with your lives. 

Unlike other riding experiences, this one is a little different. It's follows an arcade trend where if you lose all your retires, you'll have to restart the game. So it's not always about speed. It's more about using everything you have to get from point a to point b in an event. It's pretty tense in that aspect. It's sure to pump your full of adrenaline.

In terms of gameplay it's pretty simple. (PS4 Controller). R2 TO Accelerate, L2 to brake and slow down, and the right analog stick steers and does fancy advanced moves. 

The game has on one mode where you can complete the events in an area till you get to a new one. There are 4 areas and each area can have up to 10+ events. The final event is a really big boss jump. 

The game is also procedurally generated so you can never be prepared for any given moment which is kind of weird as you want to memorize the levels to get better at them. This is more reaction based. Lastly if you lose all your retires, you'll have to start from the beginning. You can get to other areas by beating the previous area boss jump 3 times which I feel is unnecessary as this just forces you to replay these areas over and over again.

You can get more retires by finishing bonus objectives in events so it's not that bad.

To summarize:

Pros:
- great visuals
- solid frame rate
- there is quite a bit of customization, with bikes, clothing, sponsors and helmets and such
- tense and exhilarating gameplay
- procedurally generated means it's always fresh I guess
- soundtrack is awesome and fitting for this game

Cons:
- there are occasional fps dips, screen tears, and pop in when going at high speeds.
- the shortcut stuff is annoying. Why can't we go to the next area when we finish the first area. Seems a bit pedantic and redundant
- no multiplayer lol. This needs to happen 
- the bonus objectives sometimes can't be completed. For example sometimes you may get a bonus objective that asks you to do 2 backflips, but there is only on one jump opportunity in the event. Yea the procedurally generated stuff can sometimes mis match. Needs tuning

Overall a great experience. I was terrible at the beginning but I got better over time and started to love the adrenaline rush the game gave me. I only got to play 1 hour but I'm clamouring to play more lol

Cheers

39960156.review:
Descenders es un juego de descenso en bicis con niveles generados proceduralmente teniendo 3 factores en cuenta; lo empinado del mapa, el número de curvas y el número de saltos/obstáculos, pudiendo encontrar niveles muy sencillos con todos los factores al minimo o endiablados si esta todo al máximo. Aparte hay otros factores aleatorios como puede ser el clima o la noche y los niveles de especiales de tu equipo.

Te estarás preguntando que narices es eso de los equipos en un juego de bicis, bueno, el juego tiene 3 equipos cada cúal con sus niveles especiales de vez en cuando:

-Kinetic: Para los que aman la velocidad de vertigo

-Enemy: Para los amantes de los trucos

-Arboreal: Para los que adoran ir campo a traves, por que si, en este juego no necesitas seguir el circuito, si lo haces tendras checkpoints y demas, pero con llegar a la meta sirve.

Por el momento el juego cuenta con 4 zonas, la inicial que es como unos campos sin demasiada dificultad, un bosque creado por el mismisimo diablo, el cañon y la zona artica o con nieve a la cual nunca he llegado. Al final de cada zona hay un "boss" que simplemente es un salto grande que tienes que hacer (no obligatoriamente pero lo necesitas para desbloquear el atajo a la nueva zona sin tener que rejugar todas las anteriores) para darte una idea, el primero es saltar sobre un puente por el que esta pasando un tren.

El juego tiene un sistema de "experiencia" con el que cada cosa que hagas ganarás puntos y al morir o retirarte perderas un porcentaje de la misma, lo que te posicionará en un puesto de la clasificación online.

Hablando de online, no permite jugar con otras personas aunque se está estudiando la manera de implementar algún tipo de interacción como algun circuito u arena con la que hacer el idiota con desconocidos.

Con lo que si que cuenta el juego es con personalización, de momento puedes desbloquear bicis, cascos, camisetas, pantalones y gafas aunque en un futuro se añadirán cosas como banderas y timbres.

¿Recomendaría el juego? Sí. La idea de los niveles generados aleatoriamente hace que cada partida sea distinta y no te sea posible aprenderte cada circuito. Le faltan cosas pero es totalmente disfrutable en su estado actual. Aunque si no te gusta siempre puedes pedir un reembolso si juegas menos de 2 horas los 14 dias tras hacer la compra :)

39956961.review:
Played the beta extensively and was already sold at that point.

If you've been looking for a pretty realistic feeling biking game, a game that currently sits between the lines of not too much Sim but not too much Arcade, this game will scratch that itch well.  Don't be scared of the Early Access listing, this game is very polished for a title that is in Early Access and sets a great example for where a title should be when hitting Early Access. The controls and the bike itself feel incredible, the maps within the 4 zones currently available are randomly generated to constantly give you a new ride every time you play. You can sink in hours at a time or just play a run and feel satisfied.

You can pick a team to earn specific gear for that team as you level up from successful runs, and also provides you with a team specific area that you can choose to do in a run. Each team is meant to represent a different way of playing the game: Enemy for Tricking and Stunts, Aboreal for trail-less riding/offroading, and Kinetic for fast and curvy trails. 

I picked Enemy because I LOVE doing tricks and stunts in this game. Team Enemy tends to bail the most and the hardest, but after we eat enough dirt, we come back hard and fast with crazy moves. There are some new players that feel dissuaded to trick and stunt because of losing XP or Leaderboard positions, but half the fun of being Enemy is getting so familiar with the game and controls where you can pull off these tricks off big tricks on big stunts and land them consistently. Using practice mode will be a big help. You're missing out on some good times if you pass up tricking, don't be scared to eat some dirt, embrace it and master it!

You lose 1% of your total XP every time you bail during your ride and 5% if you lose all your HP in a run, which basically lowers your rank on the leaderboard and holds you back from leveling up with your team to unlock new cosmetics. There is a practice mode where you can do a run without worrying about losing XP. You can still unlock Cosmetics that aren't tied to your team randomly after finishing runs, doesn't matter if you survive the run or not. You also wont lose Team Cosmetics if you rank down from the rank you unlocked them.

Once you run down to your last life, you will enter LAST STAND. One more wipe after Last Stand will Rekt you and make you lose 5% of your XP, but you are rewarded with 2X XP for everything you do while in Last Stand.

You also have health, which you lose from doing bails, and even more from harder bails. Completing the bonus objective for a map will give you health back and more XP. Bails are only punishing if you are concerned with leaderboard rank or cosmetics for your team. Even then, you're going to have to spend some time bailing to practice doing stunts or big moves. You can quickly get your rep back as you get better at the game and feel out the zones.

There are currently 4 total areas in the game with 3 locked. You can progress to a new zone by beating the boss jump, and can unlock the ability to skip the previous zone once you complete the boss jump of the zone before it 3 times.

This title is in a great spot, where its easy to pick up and play, but hard to master and do the most incredible of tricks and cleanest of runs without bailing. It encourages you to play how you want, take your time or go crazy. No timers so you don't have to be restricted or stressed out by that, all that matters is enjoying your runs in your own way. The bailing will go away with time and practice.

In my opinion, the amount of content in this game is practically limitless if you can have fun just getting better at handling yourself and your bike, as well as going to do bigger stunts and actually landing them. Yes there are a lot of other games you can get on at the price point its at, but you're not going to find any other biking game even close to the realm Descenders is in. It just depends on if you get hooked on the mechanical feel of the game itself or not. 

I personally love it and the procedural generation provides a constantly changing playground to experiment on. I play the game personally just because it feels so solid mechanically and I love Mountain Biking, its a blast to trick and stunt through these worlds. Leaderboards are fun and can help give you another goal to orient your focus on, but can dissuade people from trying to stunt or trick. I think it makes landing those tricks and stunts in a real run just that much more satisfying, and if you aren't comfortable with a zone yet, you can always hit practice mode.

I highly recommend it for any other biking fans out there. For those not into biking as much, it can have the appeal of how Skate had the appeal to others with making your own fun and challenges, and just getting better at riding. The dev team has always been very friendly and active with us on the Descenders Discord (which I highly recommend joining if you get the game, or stopping by if you have some questions for players or the devs) and I can tell a lot of love has been put into this game already.

The community that has grown is super friendly, active, and fun to talk with as well. Between the great team behind this game and the wonderful community, I can only imagine what else is in store for Descenders future.  Well worth the wait and the money, one of the best games I've played in a while.

-Smooth but sturdy controls
-No noticable bugs (my experience)
-Unlock new items for your biker when completing levels

Cons:
-High price when taking in account replayability and early access
-Not a huge amount of capabilities in terms of content
-Singleplayer (not a con if you don't mind singleplayer games)

In conclusion I think that unless you are sure that you will enjoy this game, you should probably follow this games development and judge for yourself whether you want to play it. I like the game but I think they should try to encorporate multiplayer and add some more content as for the current price there are many other games that could be worth your money.

Overall rating - 5.5/10
